alert.note: Alert for Richmond (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 3:35PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Bergen, Essex, Hudson, Passaic and Union. In southeast New York, Richmond (Staten Island). * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to developing thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain had fallen in spots earlier today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are likely over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newark, Jersey City, Paterson, Elizabeth, Passaic, Bayonne, Hoboken, Bloomfield, Hackensack, Linden, Orange, Lyndhurst, Rutherford, Secaucus, Harrison, Ridgefield, Todt Hill, Huguenot, Union City and Port Richmond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
